Generate me a questionnaire on WorkLife Balance

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **On average, how many hours do you work per day including overtime (if any)? If not applicable please write N / A.**  
  - Hours worked: __   	Overtime:__     Not Applicable : X

**Do your personal and professional responsibilities feel balanced? Please select the answer that best describes this balance:**
- Strongly agree, it feels very well managed.      (5)
- Somewhat Agree                                (3)  
 - Neither agreed or disagree          	(2)   
 - Not quite but almost              (4)    
 - Totally Disagreed: It is not balanced at all!        (1)      

**Do you feel encouraged to take time off and recharge? Please select the answer that best describes this encouragement:**  
- Strongly agree, it feels very well managed.     	(5) 
 - Somewhat Agree                                (3)   
 - Neither agreed or disagree          	        (2)    
 - Not quite but almost              (4)      
 - Totally Disagreed: I am not encouraged at all!         (1)  

**Do you feel that your work schedule allows for a good quality of life? Please select the answer that best describes this:**   	 
- Strongly agree, it feels very well managed.      (5)    
 - Somewhat Agree                                (3)      
 - Neither agreed or disagree          	        (2)  
 - Not quite but almost              (4)        
 - Totally Disagreed: I do not have a good quality of life at all!          (1)     

**Do you feel that your work schedule allows for enough time to be spent with family and friends? Please select the answer that best describes this:**   	 
- Strongly agree, it feels very well managed.     (5)  
 - Somewhat Agree                                (3)      
 - Neither agreed or disagree          	        (2)     
 - Not quite but almost              (4)        
 - Totally Disagreed: I do not have enough time for family and friends!          (1)    

**Do you feel that your work schedule allows a good amount of personal / me-time? Please select the answer that best describes this:**   	 
- Strongly agree, it feels very well managed.      (5)  
 - Somewhat Agree                                (3)      
 - Neither agreed or disagree          	        (2)    
 - Not quite but almost              (4)        
 - Totally Disagreed: I do not have any me-time at all!          (1)     
Please also provide some suggestions on how the company can help employees achieve a better work life balance.
     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on WorkLife Balance

     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement.

 **Do you feel that your work and personal life are well balanced at this time, or is one area taking priority over another (1 being very unbalanced; 5 being perfectly in balance)? Please specify which areas.**
 - Very Unbalanced: Personal Life takes more importance than Work.
- Somewhat Unbalanced: Still think that theres a need for improvement but not critical at the moment, or personal life is taking priority over work with some room to improve on this aspect as well and vice versa (5 being perfectly in balance). 	o - Quite Balanced: Personal Life takes more importance than Work.

}

},

}
]
},

}
]
},
{
"CODE": "Q5",
"NAME": "How many hours of vacation do you take per year?",
"TYPE\_ID": 2,
"DISPLAY\_ORDER": 5,
"\_TF\_ANSWERS": [
{
"ANSWER": "More than 15 days"
},
{
"ANSWER": "10 to 15 days"
},
{

},
{
"ANSWER": "Less than 5 days"
},
{

}
]
}
]
}
}

This JSON object represents a questionnaire about work-life balance. The questionnaire has five questions, each with a unique code, name, and set of possible answers. The questions are displayed in a specific order, and the type of question is also specified. The possible answers are also displayed in a specific order. The first question asks about the number of hours worked in a week, the second about personal plans being disrupted, the third about work interfering with personal plans, the fourth about overall satisfaction with work-life balance, and the fifth about the number of vacation days taken. The answers are represented as strings.

This JSON object represents a questionnaire with 5 questions. The first question asks how often the respondent needs to manage others' tasks or projects in a typical week, and the possible answers are percentages of time spent on work management. The second and third questions ask how the respondent determines if someone's workload is too high or too low, and the possible answers are based on feedback, complaints, or performance issues or using certain metrics to measure the load and capacity. The fourth and fifth questions ask what steps the respondent takes when someone's workload is too high or too low, and the possible answers are redistributing tasks or projects among team members or increasing or decreasing the tasks or projects of the person. The questionnaire code is "WORKLOAD\_MANAGEMENT", and the questions are displayed in order.

[LLM ANSWER]
 **Current workload:** How would you rate your current overall workload? Too high, just right or too low. Please explain why and what types of tasks are included in this assessment (e-mail communication, meetings etc.). Is there enough time to complete these activities within the given deadlines without feeling stressed out about it all day long because everything seems so urgent that needs immediate attention even though not being able manage them properly due lack resources such as people or technology.
 	* Too High: Can you provide specific examples of tasks which are causing your workload to be too high? How many hours per week do you spend on these activities and how much time would make it more comfortable for you, considering the importance level associated with each task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Just Right: Is there a balance between types of tasks that need attention or everything seems equally important at first glance? How many hours per week do you spend on these activities and how much time would make it more comfortable for you, considering the importance level associated with each task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Too Low: Is there a lack of tasks to keep busy during working day or feeling underutilized because not enough work is available? How many hours per week do you spend on these activities and how much time would make it more comfortable for you, considering the importance level associated with each task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Don't Know: Is there a difficulty in understanding what exactly constitutes as "work" or not sure about current workload due to lack of information? Please provide specific details on this topic.
**Prioritization:** How do you prioritize your tasks currently, if at all? What factors are taken into consideration when deciding which task should be handled first and why certain things get pushed back further in line even though they might seem more important than others initially but end up being less pressing due to various reasons.
 	* Deadline: Is there a strict deadline associated with each activity or some tasks can wait until later time without causing any harm? How does this affect your decision-making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day, considering importance level and urgency of every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Importance: Are there certain types of work considered more important than others due to their nature or impact they have on overall performance? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day, considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Urgency: Is there a difference in how quickly certain tasks need to be completed compared with others due their nature or effect they have on overall performance? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day, considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Resources: Are there enough resources available such as people, technology etc. to handle all tasks effectively or some are missing which causes certain things get pushed back further in line even though they might seem more important than others initially but end up being less pressing due lack of necessary tools? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
**Decision Making:** What factors are taken into consideration when deciding how to handle a certain activity or not, including time constraints associated with it? Is there enough information available about each case before making any decision on whether should be handled personally by self and if so then what resources would need access in order make progress without feeling overwhelmed due lack of necessary tools.
 	* Personal Preference: Are you someone who prefers handling certain tasks yourself rather than delegating them to others even though they might seem less important at first glance but end up being more pressing because not having enough time or energy required for completion within given deadlines? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency of every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Availability: Are there certain times during working hours when you feel more alert, awake or focused compared with others due physical limitations such as jet lag etc.? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency of every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Resources: Are there enough resources available including people, technology to handle all tasks effectively or some are missing which causes certain things get pushed back further in line even though they might seem more important than others initially but end up being less pressing due lack necessary tools? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Importance: Are there certain types of work considered more important than others based on their nature or impact they have in overall performance? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Urgency: Is there a difference between how quickly certain tasks need to be completed compared with others due their nature or effect they have on overall performance? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgacy for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
**Working Hours:** What are current working hours, including any breaks if applicable. Is there enough time allocated between tasks or feeling rushed due lack of sufficient breathing space in schedule? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Regular Hours: Are you someone who prefers regular working hours such as nine to five or more flexible with timing, including possibility of starting earlier in morning if needed? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Flexible Hours: Are you someone who can work at any time during twenty four hour period without feeling tired or stressed out due flexible working hours? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Shifts: Are you someone who works in shifts such as three days on, two off or four ten hour shift pattern with regular breaks included? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Breaks: Are you someone who takes scheduled breaks during working hours, including lunch break or short fifteen minute pauses between tasks to recharge batteries? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
**Workload Management:** What are current strategies used in managing workloads, including any specific techniques or tools applied. Is there a balance between types of tasks that need attention such as e mail communications versus face to face interactions? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Prioritize: Are you someone who prefers handling certain types of tasks first, even though they might seem less important at a glance but end up being more pressing due lack time or energy required to complete within given deadlines? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Delegate: Are you someone who prefers delegating certain tasks, even though they might seem more important initially but end up being less pressing due lack resources such as people or technology? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Postpone: Are you someone who prefers postponing certain tasks, even though they might seem more important initially but end up being less pressing due lack resources such as people or technology? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Limit: Are you someone who prefers limiting certain types of tasks, even though they might seem more important initially but end up being less pressing due lack resources such as people or technology? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?
 	* Techniques: Are there any specific techniques used in managing workload, including time management strategies like Pomodoro technique or Eisenhower matrix? How does this affect your decision making process while prioritizing different activities throughout the day considering importance level and urgency for every task type (e-mail communication vs meetings)?

[SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100019
     - Topic: Health and Safety Measures
     - Question number: 7

[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100061
     - Topic: Workplace Culture
     - Question number: 6
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Workplace Culture

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **On a scale of 1 to 5, how would you rate your overall satisfaction with the workplace culture at our company (where 1 is very dissatisfied)? What about if I ask for ratings from -3 and +3?**
  	- (-2) Strongly disagree / High level dislike. This person really hates it!
    - (-1) Somewhat disagreed, but not strongly enough to say they hate the culture here at our company (or that this is a big problem). 0 Neutral: Neither agree nor Disagree with current workplace environment and its cultural elements in place today. +2 Agrees quite highly; This person really likes it!
    - (+3) Strongly agrees, or loves everything about the culture at our company (or that this is a big positive). 	- **Do you think there are any negative aspects of your current workplaces cultural environment?** If yes: * Yes. I have experienced some negatives in my time here and would like to share them with management so they can be improved.* No, not at all; The culture is perfect!
    - 	- **Do you feel comfortable sharing negative opinions about the company's workplace cultural environment?** If yes: * Yes. I am happy that people are able (and encouraged) to speak up and share their thoughts on how we can improve.* No, not at all; This person does NOT want others knowing they have a problem with something in place here today!
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is inclusive?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that everyone feels included and welcome as part of our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they belong in place here today!
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is transparent?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people can see through things and understand whats going on.* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they know enough about how we operate here today!
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is diverse?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today!
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is strong?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today!
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is positive?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today!
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is supportive?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is open to new ideas?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is collaborative?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is inclusive?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is transparent?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is diverse?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is strong?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is positive?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is supportive?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is open to new ideas?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is collaborative?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is inclusive?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !
    - 	- **Do you think the company's workplace culture is transparent?** If yes: * Yes. I believe that people from all walks of life and background can be found in our team!* Not sure, or No because this would mean there are some groups who do not feel like they fit into place here today !

[LLM ANSWER]
 **Questionaire: Assessing the Working ENvironment (AWE)**
=========================
1. How would you rate your overall satisfaction with this working environment? Please select one of these options  5 means very satisfied, and 1 means not at all happy about it! What is YOUR score out of five for **Overall Satisfaction** in the workplace: [Strongly Agree / Somewhat agree/ Neutral or Undecided (Neither)/Somehow disagree/ Strongly Disagree]
2. Do you feel that your physical workspace supports and enables a productive workday? Please select one of these options  5 means very much, while only giving it score out five for **Physical Workspace** in the workplace: [Strongly Agree / Somewhat agree/ Neutral or Undecided (Neither)/Somehow disagree/ Strongly Disagree]
3. How would you rate your relationship with colleagues? Please select one of these options  5 means very good, and only giving it score out five for **Colleagues** in the workplace: [Strongly Agree / Somewhat agree/ Neutral or Undecided (Neither)/Somehow disagree/ Strongly Disagree]
4. How would you rate your relationship with managers? Please select one of these options  5 means very good, and only giving it score out five for **Managers** in the workplace: [Strongly Agree / Somewhat agree/ Neutral or Undecided (Neither)/Somehow disagree/ Strongly Disagree]
5. How well do you feel that your skills are being used? Please select one of these options  5 means very much, and only giving it score out five for **Skills Utilization** in the workplace: [Strongly Agree / Somewhat agree/ Neutral or Undecided (Neither)/Somehow disagree/ Strongly Disagree]
6. How would you rate your opportunities to learn new things? Please select one of these options  5 means very much, and only giving it score out five for **Learning Opportunities** in the workplace: [Strongly Agree / Somewhat agree/ Neutral or Undecided (Neither)/Somehow disagree/ Strongly Disagree]
7. How would you rate your ability to balance work life and personal time? Please select one of these options  5 means very much, while only giving it score out five for **Work-Life Balance** in the workplace: [Strongly Agree / Somewhat agree/ Neutral or Undecided (Neither)/Somehow disagree/ Strongly Disagree]
8. How would you rate your ability to work remotely? Please select one of these options  5 means very much, and only giving it score out five for **Remote Work** in the workplace: [Strongly Agree / Somewhat agree/ Neutral or Undecided (Neither)/Somehow disagree/ Strongly Disagree]
9. How would you rate your ability to work with a team? Please select one of these options  5 means very much, and only giving it score out five for **Working as Part Of A Team** in the workplace: [Strongly Agree / Somewhat agree/ Neutral or Undecided (Neither)/Somehow disagree/ Strongly Disagree]
10. How would you rate your ability to work with different people? With only the questionnaire TOPIC

-------------------
[SAMPLE] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100035
     - Topic: Onboarding Experience
     - Question number: 6

-------------------
[TEST] QUESTIONNAIRE_ID: 500100066
     - Topic: Workplace Environment
     - Question number: 7
-------------------
[PROMPTS]
     - System: 
You are a Questionnaire Generator that helps HR users investigate phenomena within the company.
Firstly, the user will ask you to generate a questionnaire specifying the topic.
Then, the user will ask to convert it into a specified format.
Be creative and vary the syntax of your questions to enhance user engagement. 

     - User: 
Generate me a questionnaire on Workplace Environment

-------------------
-------------------
[LLM ANSWER]
 **Do you feel that your workplace environment is conducive for productivity and creativity in general? Please elaborate.** 
- Yes, completely (Please specify why)
- Somewhat yes but there are still some areas to improve. Kindly provide details if possible! :)
- No not at all because of the following reasons: ...
- Not sure yet as I haven't had enough time or experience in this environment :D 
> **Do you think your current workplace is comfortable and encourages a positive attitude?** (Please specify why) Yes, definitely. The temperature here feels perfect! :) No not at all because of the following reasons: ...  
- Somewhat yes but there are still some areas to improve like providing healthier food options or better lighting in certain places :/ 	> **Do you think your workplace environment is accessible and easy for everyone?** (Please specify why) Yes, completely. Everything seems within reach! :) No not at all because of the following reasons: ...  
- Somewhat yes but there are still some areas to improve like installing ramps or elevators in certain places :/ 	> **Do you think your workplace environment is safe and secure?** (Please specify why) Yes, completely. I feel very comfortable here! :) No not at all because of the following reasons: ...  
> **How would rate overall quality of work space on scale from one to ten whereby:** * 1-2 = Unacceptable*   3-5= Needs improvement (Please specify what needs improving)	6 or more is acceptable. If you could, please provide details about your rating: ...  
> **Do the current lighting conditions in our workplace support productivity?** Yes definitely! I can see everything clearly and feel very comfortable :). No not at all because of following reasons... (Please specify why!)
